description.plain:
Fifth Harmony is a girl group that formed out of contestants on the 2012 edition of The X Factor USA, chosen by Simon Cowell: Ally Brooke Hernandez, Normani Kordei, Lauren Jauregui, Dinah Jane Hansen, and Camila Cabello. Despite being eliminated at third place, Fifth Harmony moved on to being signed with Syco Music.

Their first album, Reflection, was released on February 3rd, 2015, and peaked at number 5 on the Billboard 200, becoming their second top ten on that chart following their 2013 EP, Better Together. The album also merited their first top-40 single, “Sledgehammer,” and their longest-charting hit single, “Worth It,” featuring Kid Ink.

Their second album, 7/27, was released on May 27th, 2016 and debuted at number 4 on the Billboard 200, making it the group’s highest charting album to date. Its lead single, “Work From Home” featuring rapper Ty Dolla Sign, catapulted the girls even further into mainstream success. The track debuted on the Billboard Hot 100 at #12 and reached #4 after 13 weeks and became the girls' highest-charting single in the U.S. and the first top-five single in the country by a girl group since “Buttons” by The Pussycat Dolls.

On December 19, 2016, it was announced via Twitter that Camila Cabello would be breaking apart from the group to further pursue solo endeavors.

On June 2, 2017, Fifth Harmony released “Down” as the first single as a four-piece group, featuring rapper Gucci Mane. Their self-titled third album followed on August 25, 2017.

On March 19, 2018, after almost six years of being a band, the group posted this statement to their social medias announcing their hiatus to “pursue solo endeavors:”

https://twitter.com/FifthHarmony/status/975718651595771904

songs.full_title: Work From Home by Fifth Harmony (Ft. Ty Dolla $ign)
songs.title: Work From Home

description.plain:
The infectious lead single from 5H’s 7/27, “Work From Home” is a bouncy pop song about sex. The girls are lonely at home while their significant others are stuck at work in the night. They ache for their lover’s touch, telling them they don’t have to go to work but instead stay home and “work” in bed, comparing their intimacy as a vacation.

The song peaked at #4 on the Billboard Hot 100 and was the group’s first top 10 hit.

songs.full_title: Worth It by Fifth Harmony (Ft. Kid Ink)
songs.title: Worth It

description.plain:
“Worth It” is the fourth track and third single of Fifth Harmony’s debut album, Reflection. It’s an urban pop song about hooking up with a man at the club while maintaining control.

It peaked at number 12 on the US Billboard Hot 100 and has been certified triple Platinum in the US. Although it’s one of Fifth Harmony’s most successful hits, Lauren didn’t think “Worth It” would “make the album.”

songs.full_title: Down by Fifth Harmony (Ft. Gucci Mane)
songs.title: Down

description.plain:
“Down” is the lead single from Fifth Harmony’s third studio album and features rapper Gucci Mane. The song marks their first official single as a foursome, with former member Camila Cabello, leaving in 2016.

The group teased the song on their social media platforms in the week prior to the release. Fifth Harmony debuted the song live on Good Morning America as a part of the Summer Concert series on June 2nd 2017:

What was such a beautiful moment was when we premiered “Down” on “Good Morning America.” It was the first music we gave [as a quartet] and it was our highest-debuting single. We found out in the car, and we were crying to each other. We were so excited. It felt so beautiful, and it pierced our souls. Everything that’s come after has been a blessing

-Ally, via LA Times

There’s also a Spanish version of the song, which was first performed at the Kids Choice Awards Mexico 2017.

songs.full_title: That's My Girl by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: That’s My Girl

description.plain:
“That’s My Girl” is a song by vocal group Fifth Harmony recorded for their sophomore album 7/27 and was released as the third promo single from the LP.

The song was originally written in sessions for singer-songwriter Tinashe’s sophomore album Joyride alongside two other tracks that were eventually given to Fifth Harmony: “The Life” and “Scared Of Happy”

A Digital Remix EP was released to promote the single featuring 4 new versions of the track. The group also released a new edit after Camila Cabello’s departure, removing the singer’s vocals.

songs.full_title: All in My Head (Flex) by Fifth Harmony (Ft. Fetty Wap)
songs.title: All in My Head (Flex)
songs.title_with_featured: All in My Head (Flex) (Ft. Fetty Wap)

description.plain:
“All In My Head (Flex)” is the second single off Fifth Harmony’s  7/27. The song was premiered during the 2016 Billboard Music Awards. It’s Dinah’s favorite song of the 7/27 era.

This song credits over 20 people as songwriters. Five of these are Fifth Harmony members. Three are Benny Blanco and StarGate, the Swedish duo who produced this track. One is Julia Michaels—the notable songwriter who penned the major hits of 2015, working with Justin Bieber, Selena Gomez, and Gwen Stefani. The Canadian rapper, singer and self-proclaimed ghostwriter Tory Lanez got a writing cred, as well as Fetty Wap, who contributed two verses to the song. Sir Nolan is an LA-based songwriter and producer who’s worked with major acts like Nick Jonas and Pitbull, and Simon Wilcox is a Canadian singer-songwriter who’s written music for television and film.

Besides the onslaught of contemporary pop writers who helped write this song, there are many major reggae songwriters and producers credited, because this song is based on the 1993 Mad Cobra reggae crossover hit “Flex.” This song was originally penned by Mad Cobra, Clifton Dillon, Sly Dunbar (one half of the reggae duo Sly & Robbie) and Brian Thompson.  There was a cover of “Flex” made by 2Pistols in 2008, with the reggae producer Handel Tucker and Leroy Romans, a producer who played with the original Wailers. Clifton Dillon is a big producer in Jamaica, and also the mentor of OMI. Richard Foulks is another reggae artist associated with Yellowman records.

songs.title: He Like That

description.plain:
“He Like That” is the third single to be released off Fifth Harmony’s self-titled album. The girls have described the track as “sexy” and “a little dirty”. It also features an interpolation of MC Hammer’s 1994 song “Pumps and a Bump”.

The track was released as a single on August, 25, 2017. A music video for the song was released on the same day. Fifth Harmony first performed this song live at Urban Outfitters on that same day.

songs.full_title: Don't Say You Love Me by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Don’t Say You Love Me

description.plain:
“Don’t Say You Love Me” is a song by vocal group Fifth Harmony from their final, self-titled album. The song was a fan-favourite and was re-released on May 18, 2018. as the final single from the album, alongside a music video, as a tribute to their fans for their support.

The track was originally sent to the group as a demo by songwriters Lisa Scinta and Nate Cyphert and production duo Electric. The group then reproduced and edited the song with Ian Kirkpatrick for the album.

songs.full_title: Angel by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Angel

description.plain:
“Angel” is the eighth track of Fifth Harmony’s self-titled album. The group released the audio of the song on August 10, 2017, and the music video one day later.

The track finds them rhetorically questioning “Who said I was an angel?”, mocking an ex-lover who was “too inconsistent” while simultaneously proving that they are not to be messed with.

Fifth Harmony first performed this song live at the FYE Album Release party.

songs.full_title: BO$$ by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: BO$$

description.plain:
“BO$$” is the second track and lead single of Fifth Harmony’s debut album, Reflection. The song serves as a feminist anthem, encouraging young girls to be independent and mentions successful women such as Oprah Winfrey and Michelle Obama. The official music video was released on July 7, 2014.

As many fans noted, Dinah didn’t have a solo part on this song. According to her, it was because the producers felt her voice wasn’t suited for pop. This also happened in 5H’s following single, “Sledgehammer”.

Fifth Harmony promoted a self-esteem campaign with DoSomething.org called #ImABoss. According to Ally:

We believe that everyone is the boss of something. The #ImABoss campaign is exactly in line with our new single “BO$$” because it’s all about owning and sharing what makes you confident and strong.

“BO$$” peaked at number 43 on US Billboard Hot 100. It was also certified Platinum in the US.

songs.full_title: No Way by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: No Way

description.plain:
“No Way” is the final track of the American deluxe version of Fifth Harmony’s sophmore album 7/27, The song talks about a relationship that looks toxic from the outside even though the two of them are in love. According to Lauren:

We were able to emote in a way we hadn’t ever done before in our music and I think that was why it is my favorite because I felt at the time and every time I hear it now the emotion behind the words; and I hadn’t felt that connected to any of the songs in that way before. I love the vulnerability and the reality of the situation.

songs.full_title: Sledgehammer by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Sledgehammer

description.plain:
“Sledgehammer” is the third track and second single of Fifth Harmony’s debut album, Reflection. In this electro-pop track, the group compares the visceral side of a crush to being hit with a sledgehammer.

As many fans noted, Dinah didn’t have a solo part on this song. According to her, it was because the producers felt her voice wasn’t suited for pop. This also happened in 5H’s previous single, “BO$$”.

The song peaked at number 40 on US Billboard Hot 100 and was certified Platinum in the US.

songs.full_title: The Life by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: The Life

description.plain: “The Life” is a song by vocal group Fifth Harmony. It was released as a promo single prior to their sophomore album 7/27. Tinashe, one of the songwriters of this song, has also worked with the group years prior on official single “That’s My Girl.” The Tinashe version of the song leaked in 2018 and features an unknown dancehall artist.

songs.full_title: Write On Me by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Write On Me

description.plain:
“Write On Me” is the second promo single from Fifth Harmony’s  album 7/27, set to be released on May 27th, 2016. The lyrics contain imagery of drawing and writing as a metaphor for the effect that a romantic relationship could have on someone’s life.

 The song matches an acoustic guitar with the kind of tropical house-inspired vibe that took over pop in 2015 and ’16. In fact, the track was co-produced by Kygo, the Norwegian DJ who helped make tropical house an international sensation. He’s joined by fellow Norwegians Stargate, the production and songwriting team known for their close collaboration with Rihanna.

songs.full_title: Deliver by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Deliver

description.plain:
“Deliver” is the the most R&B song in Fifth Harmony’s self-titled album. It was written by Taylor Parks, who also wrote Fifth Harmony’s feminist anthem “BO$$”. Dinah described the track as “the kinda song for when you’re getting down with your man.”

Fifth Harmony first performed this song live at the FYE Album Release party.

The song was released as a promotional single on September 8, 2017, along with a music video.

songs.full_title: Reflection by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Reflection

description.plain:
“Reflection” is a sassy and self-empowering anthem which the girls trick a boy into thinking they’re complimenting him when, in fact, they’re talking about themselves. It is the the ninth track off of Fifth Harmony’s debut album of the same name, Reflection. The song also has references to the popular tale of Snow White and The Seven Dwarfs.

It is Dinah’s favorite song to perform.

songs.full_title: I'm in Love with a Monster by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: I’m in Love with a Monster
songs.title_with_featured: I'm in Love with a Monster

description.plain:
“I’m in Love with a Monster” was released on August 3rd 2015, following Fifth Harmony’s 2015 album Reflection, which achieved #5 on the Billboard 200.

The song was created for the soundtrack to the animated comedy film Hotel Transylvania 2. In this sultry pop tune, the group sings about their relationship with a not so innocent partner; adding a little spice to their sweet life.

The music video to the song was released on August 27, 2015.

songs.full_title: Miss Movin' On by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Miss Movin’ On

description.plain:
“Miss Movin' On” is the second track of Fifth Harmony’s debut EP, Better Together. It is also the first single from the group, released just six months after their season of The X Factor had ended. It debuted at number 86 on the Billboard Hot 100, the highest from an act that came from X Factor USA. The single peaked at number 76 on Billboard Hot 100 and has been certified Gold in the US. There is a Spanish version of the song called “Sin Tu Amor”. It is featured on their EP Juntos.

The girls first performed this song on the Harmonize America Tour at Lansing, MI, on July 13, 2013. When performing the song live, Ally sometimes sung Lauren’s part on the second verse. Following Camila’s exit, Normani sings her part in the first verse and Ally sings her lines in the chorus.

songs.full_title: Who Are You by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Who Are You

description.plain:
“Who Are You” is the fourth track of Fifth Harmony’s debut EP, Better Together. It is a heartfelt ballad about loving someone who can’t make up their mind about their relationship, thus making it toxic.

There’s a Spanish version of this song named “Eres Tú”. It is featured on the Juntos EP.

The girls first performed this song on September 6 at Silver Spring, MD, during the I Wish tour, when they performed as special guests for Cher Lloyd.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wxe55fkdilU

songs.full_title: Lonely Night by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Lonely Night

description.plain:
“Lonely Night” is the sixth track of Fifth Harmony’s self-titled album. The track which was written by Normani and Dinah finds them asserting to a boy that they are able to see-through his lies and if they aren’t treated right, “it’s gonna be a lonely night” for him.

Fifth Harmony first performed this song live at the FYE Album Release party.

songs.full_title: Bridges by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Bridges

description.plain:
“Bridges” is the first song in which Fifth Harmony discusses politics. According to Lauren:

Lots of people want to keep (politics) out of their art because they assume the role of, ‘I’m the distraction, I’m the escapism, I’m the thing that people use to check out of the world,’ so a lot of people don’t want to get involved, not because they’re scared, but because they don’t want to have those conflicts

During a Facebook live, the girls described the song as a message of hope as well as a product of their “passion about what was going on in the world”.

Fifth Harmony first performed this song live at the FYE Album Release party.

songs.full_title: Squeeze by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Squeeze

description.plain:
“Squeeze” is the seventh track of Fifth Harmony’s second album, 7/27. It’s a riveting song about wanting some comfort in a time of vulnerability. The squeeze is the action of a hug – a strong yet comforting hug.

In a Facebook livestream, member Dinah Jane revealed this to be one of her favorite songs off the album, along with “All in My Head (Flex).”

description.plain:
“Not That Kinda Girl” is the tenth track from Fifth Harmony’s second studio album, 7/27. The song features legendary producer and rapper Missy Elliott.

Fifth Harmony’s Lauren Jauregui told Radio.com:

We are so excited about the fact that we have a collab with Missy Elliot on our album. It’s actually insane. We are genuine Missy fans and we all listened to her growing up. She’s such an icon and legend in the music industry. She’s one of the only female producers in the game and she’s so, so incredibly talented and ahead of her time. We’re so blessed to have her on a track of ours."

songs.full_title: We Know by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: We Know

description.plain:
First premiered at an acoustic session at Idolator in July, 2014, “We Know” is the second song revealed to be on Fifth Harmony’s debut album, Reflection.

Group member Camila Cabello says about the song:

This is a song that is on our upcoming album that’s coming out in the fall. And it’s a really cool acapella moment where we kinda get to sing and the melody is so sick, and if you’re a girl this song probably relates to you in some shape or form. And it bumps.

The song itself lyrically has an female empowering theme, declaring that one will not be fooled or enticed by a bad boy, no matter how attractive he is. Sonically, despite the acoustic session, it seems that the song will follow the reinvented R&B-tinged pop direction of their previous single “BO$$”, but this time with a more minimal, slow production.

description.plain:
“Like Mariah” is the seventh track of Fifth Harmony’s  debut album, Reflection. It features rapper Tyga and is an ode to Mariah Carey, who’s simply the third best-selling female in America.

The track mentions the following Mariah Carey’s songs:


“Always Be My Baby”
“Honey”
“Touch My Body”
“All I Want For Christmas Is You”
“Angels Cry”

description.plain: “All Again” is an unreleased ballad by Fifth Harmony. The song is about how much they love their ex-partners, but know it would end up badly just as it did before. The full version was leaked and surfaced online on October 8, 2018. It is speculated to be a cut song from their sophomore album, 7/27.

description.plain:
“Me and My Girls” is an iTunes exclusive track from Fifth Harmony’s debut EP, Better Together. It was also released as a promotional single on July 18, 2013.

The words “booty” in the chorus and “stupid” in the pre-chorus are censored on the Radio Disney version.

The girls first performed this song live at Lansing, MI, on July, 13, 2013, during the Harmonize America tour.

“Better Together” is the third song and title track of Fifth Harmony’s debut EP. It is about regret after breaking up with one’s boyfriend. There is a Spanish version of this song named “Tú Eres Lo Que Quiero”. It is featured on Fifth Harmony’s EP Juntos.

The girls first performed this song live on September 6, 2013, at Silver Spring, MD, when they performed as special guests for Cher Lloyd’s I Wish tour.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=skoUUVCGOdM

songs.full_title: Can You See by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Can You See

description.plain:
“Can You See” it’s the first promotional song from The Star motion picture soundtrack. The song was released on 17 October 2017. Fifth Harmony announced the single on their Twitter page five days prior to its release.

https://twitter.com/FifthHarmony/status/918958129307701255

They also shared on the realese day how excited and grateful they were to be part of such an inspirational song.

https://twitter.com/FifthHarmony/status/920301832676749313

The track employs Biblical references about the search of something to believe “the son of God” “the King of Kings” and how the light of the star (Star of Bethlehem) will take us to a brighter, better world.

songs.full_title: Voicemail by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Voicemail

description.plain:
“Voicemail” is an outtake from Fifth Harmony’s second album 7/27. This song is included in Napster version of the album. It was said by their management that several extra songs that didn’t make the album would be released throughout the year, and “Voicemail” happened to be one of them.

Camila first teased this song back in February 2016, by singing the first line of the chorus in an interview in France.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JJQctzrbt58

The group also included the song for most of their 7/27 Tour setlist.

songs.full_title: Them Girls Be Like by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Them Girls Be Like

description.plain:
On “Them Girls Be Like,” Fifth Harmony playfully embody typical girl stereotypes, poking fun at various misconceptions such as their supposed obsession with their appearance and boys, and constant fighting and jealousy among them. The track is also full of pop culture references, drawing inspiration from lines in the movie Mean Girls and using terms such as “selfie,” “no-filter pics” and “hashtags.”

The song was released as a promotional single on August 24, 2014 along with the pre-order for their debut album Reflection.

songs.title: Don’t Wanna Dance Alone

description.plain:
“Don’t Wanna Dance Alone” is the first track of Fifth Harmony’s debut EP Better Together. The track is an answer to Whitney Houston’s “I Wanna Dance With Somebody”. There is a Spanish version of the song called “Que Bailes Conmigo Hoy”. It is featured on their EP Juntos.

The group first performed the song during the Harmonize America tour in Lansing, MI.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xx7MbcEXNDA

songs.full_title: Suga Mama by Fifth Harmony
songs.title: Suga Mama

description.plain: “Suga Mama” is the tenth track of Fifth Harmony’s debut album, Reflection. A suga mama is a woman who pays for all of their man’s things and that’s exactly what the girls don’t want to be. Even though they love this man, they can’t keep paying all the time and they need him to be as financially independent as they are.
